2076670.name: Fly Me To The Home!
2076670.description:
*The game includes a soundtrack for free.
*Demo include 12/50 levels

Note: This is a difficult game

"Fly Me To The Home!" is
for the stoic hardcore gamer
or for casual gamers to upgrade to it

Overview

This is a painful action game in which the player controls an orange character and uses jet boots to overcome a difficult return journey.
By turning on and off the jets fired left and right, you fly through the sky while avoiding obstacles and return to the destination, home.
the jet spray of your left and right boots on and off!

Features

.1. simple and intuitive operation
　Anyone can easily start the game by simply turning the left and right jet boots on and off.
2. high retryability
　Players can retry immediately after a failure, making them want to try again and again until they succeed.
3. high degree of difficulty
　The gameplay tests your skill and judgement, giving you a sense of accomplishment and pain.
4. retro visuals and music
　Dot graphics and chiptune BGM create a nostalgic atmosphere.
5. single-screen stage design
　Short stages that can be selected step by step to minimise player frustration.

System

.1. 50 levels of challenging maps!
2. collect medals to get skins!
3. time attack for each level!

World view

.Loose dotted scenery, orange characters and houses.
A heartwarming world.

As the map progresses, houses are built in weirder and weirder places that are more difficult to reach.
Why are there houses in such places?
The author doesn't quite understand.

Do your best to get home!

Philosophy

.We believe that the essence of games lies in ‘the accumulation of knowledge and experience and their application’.
We have created this game to maximise the enjoyment of this essence through simple operation, high difficulty and comfortable retryability.
Enjoy!

Live Streaming and Gameplay

You DO NOT NEED to contact me or get my permission to distribute/monetize your gameplay.
*I would greatly appreciate it if you could include the name of this game in the video title and the URL of this page in the summary section.
